question.content: Why are zoos keeping pandas in captivity?

option.content: because they are endangered
because they are so rare
to increase the panda population
to make money

question.content: Why does it cost so much to keep pandas in zoos?

option.content: because they eat huge amounts of food
because they get the best care available
because China bills the zoos a million dollars a year for each panda
because the zoos send China money to protect the pandas there

question.content: What are some of the benefits of raising pandas in captivity?

option.content: the panda population is increasing
more twin pandas are being born in captivity
pandas in captivity are surviving longer
zoos receive large grants for pandas born in captivity

question.content: How has life in captivity changed for pandas in the last 10 years?

option.content: They are having more twins now.
They have more visitors now.
Fewer cubs are dying now.
Their feeding and care has greatly improved.

question.content: Why might it not be a good idea to release pandas into the wilds of China right now?

option.content: They may be preyed upon by tigers and rhinos.
The habitat may not be able to support them.
They still need to learn how to take care of themselves.
China's nature preserves are not safe places for pandas.
